definitions: stripped of all covering or surface growth; made completely bare
deprived of something essential or natural that normally covers or adorns
examples: The denuded hillside showed severe erosion damage
Wildfire left the mountains denuded of vegetation
His denuded argument lacked supporting evidence or detail
The scandal left her reputation denuded of credibility

definitions: dead; no longer living or existing in this world
having gone away from a place; having left previously
examples: The departed souls were remembered in the memorial service
She mourned her departed husband for many years
The departed guests left the house in disarray
The departed train had taken all their luggage

definitions: in the process of leaving or going away from a place
coming to an end; ceasing to exist or function
examples: The departing passengers rushed to catch their flights
She waved goodbye to the departing train
His departing words echoed in her mind for years
The departing year brought many unexpected changes

definitions: relating to or belonging to a specific department within an organization
examples: The departmental meeting covered budget allocations for next year
She received a departmental award for outstanding service

definitions: able to be relied upon; consistent in performance or behavior
examples: She's a dependable employee who never misses deadlines
This dependable car has served our family for years

definitions: needing someone or something else for support, help, or existence
determined or conditioned by something else; contingent upon another factor
examples: The dependent child relied on her parents for everything
Many species are dependent on specific habitats for survival
The outcome is dependent on weather conditions tomorrow
Your grade is dependent upon class participation

definitions: shown or represented in a picture, description, or other artistic form
examples: The scene depicted in the painting shows rural life
Characters depicted in the novel seem incredibly lifelike

definitions: used up or reduced to a very small amount; exhausted of resources
examples: The depleted uranium poses environmental risks for decades
Their depleted savings couldn't cover the medical bills

definitions: deserving strong condemnation; completely unacceptable morally or ethically
shockingly bad in quality or condition; causing dismay or disgust
examples: His deplorable behavior at the ceremony shocked everyone present
The deplorable treatment of prisoners violated human rights
The deplorable condition of the building posed safety risks
Living conditions in the camp were absolutely deplorable

definitions: having lost most or all of its population through death or migration
examples: The depopulated village stood eerily silent and abandoned
War left entire regions depopulated for generations

definitions: morally corrupt or wicked; showing moral degradation and perversion
examples: The depraved criminal showed no remorse for his actions
Such depraved behavior cannot be tolerated in society

definitions: expressing disapproval or criticism; showing that something has little value
belittling or undervaluing oneself in a modest or humorous way
examples: His deprecating remarks about her work were unnecessarily harsh
The critic's deprecating review destroyed the film's reputation
Her self-deprecating humor endeared her to the audience
He made self-deprecating jokes about his cooking skills

definitions: suffering from clinical depression or feeling very unhappy and without hope
experiencing economic decline with high unemployment and low business activity
pushed down or existing at a lower level than the surrounding area
examples: The depressed patient required immediate psychiatric intervention
She felt depressed after losing her job
The depressed economy showed no signs of recovery
Property values remained depressed throughout the recession
The depressed button wouldn't spring back into position
Water collected in the depressed area of the pavement

definitions: causing feelings of sadness and hopelessness; making someone feel depressed
examples: The depressing news about climate change worried everyone
That depressing movie left the audience in tears

definitions: suffering from a lack of basic material and cultural benefits considered necessary
having been prevented from having or using something important or valuable
examples: Children from deprived backgrounds often struggle in school
The deprived neighborhood lacked basic infrastructure
The prisoners were deprived of their basic human rights
She felt deprived of affection throughout her childhood

definitions: mad or insane; unable to think or act in a normal or logical way
examples: The deranged attacker was taken for psychiatric evaluation
His deranged behavior frightened everyone at the party

definitions: in very poor condition as a result of abandonment and neglect
shamefully negligent in performing one's duty or obligations
examples: The derelict building posed a danger to local children
Derelict ships littered the abandoned harbor
The officer was derelict in his duty to protect civilians
She was found derelict in her responsibilities as guardian

definitions: expressing contempt or ridicule; showing that something or someone is foolish
examples: His derisive laughter made her feel small and stupid
The crowd responded with derisive shouts and jeers

definitions: imitative of another work and usually disapproved of for that reason
obtained from or based on something else; not original or primary
examples: Critics dismissed the film as derivative and predictable
Her derivative writing style lacks authentic voice
These derivative products are based on underlying securities
The derivative work required permission from the original author

definitions: obtained or developed from something else; having origins in another source
examples: The derived formula simplified complex calculations significantly
Many English words are derived from Latin roots

definitions: relating to or affecting the skin, especially the dermis layer
examples: The dermal patch delivered medication through the skin
Dermal fillers can reduce the appearance of wrinkles

definitions: relating to the branch of medicine concerned with skin diseases and conditions
examples: She scheduled a dermatological consultation for her persistent rash
The dermatological treatment cleared up his acne completely

definitions: showing a critical or disrespectful attitude; intended to belittle or disparage
examples: His derogatory comments about women angered many colleagues
The article contained derogatory references to minority groups

definitions: coming from or related to a person or group who lived in the past
examples: The descendant population still practices ancient traditions
Descendant languages evolved from a common proto-language

definitions: moving or extending downward; going from higher to lower position
examples: The descendent pathway led deep into the valley
Descendent air currents brought cooler temperatures

definitions: moving down or downward; going from a higher to lower level
arranged in order from highest to lowest or largest to smallest
examples: The descending aircraft prepared for landing approach
We watched the descending elevator through glass doors
Sort the numbers in descending order from largest to smallest
The descending scale showed priorities from most to least important

definitions: represented or characterized in words; given a verbal account or representation
examples: The described symptoms matched those of influenza perfectly
The previously described method proved most effective

definitions: giving a detailed account in words; serving to describe or portray
describing how language is actually used rather than prescribing rules
examples: Her descriptive writing brought the scene vividly to life
The report included descriptive statistics about population trends
Descriptive grammar documents actual language use by speakers
The descriptive approach avoids making judgments about correctness

definitions: treated with violent disrespect; violated the sanctity of something sacred
examples: The desecrated cemetery shocked the entire community
Vandals had desecrated the ancient temple with graffiti

definitions: empty of people; abandoned and left without inhabitants or visitors
examples: The deserted island had no signs of human habitation
Late at night, the usually busy streets were completely deserted

definitions: rightfully earned or merited through one's actions or qualities
examples: She finally received the deserved recognition for her work
The team celebrated their deserved victory after months of training

definitions: worthy of being given help, support, or reward due to good qualities or need
examples: The deserving students received scholarships for their hard work
This deserving charity helps thousands of homeless families

definitions: thoroughly dried out; having had all moisture removed or lost
examples: The desiccated coconut added texture to the curry
Ancient desiccated remains were found in the desert tomb

definitions: appointed to a position but not yet officially installed in that role
examples: The president designate will take office next month
The ambassador designate met with foreign ministry officials

definitions: deliberately planned and made for a specific purpose or effect
intended or planned to achieve a particular purpose or goal
examples: The specially designed wheelchair improved his mobility significantly
These designed experiments will test our hypothesis
The program is designed to help struggling students succeed
The law was designed to protect consumer rights

definitions: crafty, scheming, and cunning in pursuing one's aims or interests
examples: Her designing nature became apparent when she manipulated events
The designing politician used every trick to win votes

definitions: worth having or wanting; pleasing, excellent, or beneficial to possess
sexually attractive; arousing sexual desire or interest
examples: Living downtown is desirable for young professionals
These desirable features make the house worth the price
She was considered highly desirable by many admirers
The actor played the desirable romantic lead perfectly

definitions: wanted or wished for; sought after as a goal or outcome
examples: The experiment produced the desired results after many attempts
She finally achieved her desired weight through diet and exercise

definitions: having or characterized by a strong wish or desire for something
examples: He was desirous of learning more about his ancestry
The company is desirous of expanding into new markets

definitions: empty of people and giving an impression of bleak emptiness
feeling or showing great unhappiness or loneliness
examples: The desolate landscape stretched endlessly without signs of life
After the storm, the beach looked desolate and abandoned
She felt desolate after her best friend moved away
His desolate expression revealed the depth of his grief

definitions: showing the complete loss or absence of hope; feeling or expressing despair
examples: Her despairing cry echoed through the empty house
The despairing look in his eyes revealed his hopelessness

definitions: feeling or showing hopelessness and ready to do anything regardless of danger
extremely serious or dangerous requiring immediate action
done with little hope of success as a last resort
examples: The desperate mother searched everywhere for her missing child
He made a desperate plea for help
The situation is desperate and requires immediate intervention
The hospital faces desperate shortages of medical supplies
It was a desperate attempt to save the failing company
Their desperate measures only made things worse

definitions: deserving hatred and contempt; morally reprehensible and vile
examples: His despicable treatment of animals led to criminal charges
That was a despicable thing to say about your friend

definitions: regarded with intense dislike, contempt, or disgust by others
examples: The despised dictator finally fled the country
He became the most despised figure in the scandal

definitions: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage; feeling extreme discouragement
examples: She became despondent after losing her job unexpectedly
The despondent teenager refused to leave his room

definitions: exercising power in a cruel, oppressive, or arbitrary way like a tyrant
examples: The despotic ruler crushed all opposition to his regime
Her despotic management style demoralized the entire department

definitions: certain to meet a particular fate; predetermined by divine will or fate
intended or meant for a particular purpose or destination
examples: They seemed destined to meet despite living continents apart
The company was destined for greatness from its inception
The shipment is destined for overseas markets
These funds are destined for educational programs

definitions: extremely poor and lacking the means to provide for oneself
completely lacking in a particular quality or value
examples: The destitute family relied on charity for basic necessities
War left thousands destitute and homeless
The proposal was destitute of any original ideas
His argument was destitute of logical reasoning

definitions: damaged beyond repair or use; completely ruined or devastated
examples: The destroyed building was scheduled for demolition
Fire left the forest destroyed beyond recognition

definitions: causing great damage or harm to something or someone physically
causing psychological or social harm; tending to destroy or undermine
examples: The destructive hurricane left thousands homeless
Termites can be destructive to wooden structures
His destructive behavior alienated all his friends
Destructive criticism offers no constructive solutions
